clinical_study.official_title: Calorie Restriction With Leucine Supplementation in Postmenopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether consuming additional leucine during calorie restriction induced weight loss has beneficial or harmful effects on multi-organ (liver, muscle, adipose tissue) insulin sensitivity, colonocyte proliferation rates, the gut microbiome, muscle mass and function, and bone mineral density in obese, postmenopausal women.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group
primary_outcome.description: We will measure total appendicular skeletal muscle mass by using dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) and thigh muscle volume by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group
primary_outcome.description: We will evaluate muscle strength by administering maximum one repetition strength and isokinetic strength tests.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in bone mineral density and bone mineral content
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group
primary_outcome.description: We will evaluate total bone mass and total body and regional bone mineral density by using dual X-ray energy absorptiometry (DXA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skeletal muscle insulin sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group
secondary_outcome.description: We will evaluate insulin sensitivity using the hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp procedure in conjunction with stable isotope labeled tracer infusions

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in bacterial populations found in the stool
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cell proliferation (growth) rates in the colon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 10% weight loss in calorie restriction groups and ~6 to 7 months in the weight maintenance group
secondary_outcome.description: We will examine colon cell proliferation rates using stable isotope labelled tracer methods in conjunction with sigmoid colon biopsy samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the acute effect of leucine ingestion on skeletal muscle insulin sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to starting the weight loss or maintenance intervention
secondary_outcome.description: We will evaluate insulin sensitivity using the hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp procedure in conjunction with stable isotope labeled tracer infusions

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the acute effect of leucine ingestion on muscle protein metabolism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to starting the weight loss or maintenance intervention
secondary_outcome.description: We will assess rates of muscle protein synthesis, breakdown and net protein balance using stable isotope labeled tracer methods during postabsorptive conditions and during insulin infusion with or without leucine ingestion.

arm_group.description: Weight maintenance with normal protein and leucine intake

arm_group.arm_group_label: Weight loss with normal protein intake

intervention.intervention_name: Weight loss with normal protein and leucine intake
intervention.description: Goal of 8 to 10% weight loss while consuming the recommended daily allowance of protein (i.e, 0.8 grams of protein per kg body weight per day).
intervention.arm_group_label: Weight loss with normal protein intake

intervention.description: Goal of 8 to 10% weight loss while consuming 150% of the recommended daily allowance of protein (i.e., 1.2 grams of protein per kg body weight per day) with the additional protein given in the form of whey protein, which has a high leucine content.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese with body mass index (BMI) between 30 and 40 kg/m2
- Postmenopausal
- Sedentary (i.e., less than 1.5 hours of exercise per week)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with diabetes and/or uncontrolled hypertension
- Individuals with hepatitis B and/or C
- Individuals who smoke
- Individuals with an allergy to whey protein

results_reference.citation: Smith GI, Yoshino J, Stromsdorfer KL, Klein SJ, Magkos F, Reeds DN, Klein S, Mittendorfer B. Protein Ingestion Induces Muscle Insulin Resistance Independent of Leucine-Mediated mTOR Activation. Diabetes. 2015 May;64(5):1555-63. doi: 10.2337/db14-1279. Epub 2014 Dec 4.
